meanings.definition: One of a number of parts into which a debt is divided for payment at intervals.
meanings.sent1: I paid the first instalment of my loan yesterday.
meanings.sent2: She makes a monthly instalment to pay off her car.
meanings.sent3: The instalment for my credit card bill made me feel like a responsible adult.
meanings.sent4: Each instalment of the debt felt like a weight lifted off my shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The instalment was like a puzzle piece fitting perfectly into the bigger financial picture.

meanings.definition: A single payment within a series of payments.
meanings.sent1: The final instalment for the furniture is due next week.
meanings.sent2: He saved up for months to make the last instalment on his computer.
meanings.sent3: Receiving the instalment felt like a small victory in the midst of bills.
meanings.sent4: The last instalment was like the closing scene of a movie, tying up loose ends.
meanings.sent5: The instalment gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of financial progress.
